game

Class Score

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Score

  • public class Score
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Score monitors the score of a Game for a given Manager.
    The method that allows changing the value of the score is protected, so only files in package gameFiles are able to change the score. This prevents the user from altering the score, though function getScore() is public.

    Also maintains methods for computing the cost of traveling at a given speed for trucks and validates colors for parcels and trucks.
    Author:
    MPatashnik

    • Field Detail

      • COLOR

        public static final java.awt.Color[] COLOR
        The Colors in the game. Colors of Trucks and Parcels are chosen from this Array. Other colors are not allowed in the game, so setColor(Color c) methods mus check for c being contained in COLOR before setting.

      • manager

        public final Manager manager
        The manager for which this Score object keeps track.

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomColor

        public static java.awt.Color getRandomColor()
        Return a random Color from Score.Color.

      • colorContains

        public static boolean colorContains(java.awt.Color c)
        Return true iff c is in Score.COLOR. Use to check validity of a color assignment to any colorable thing.
        Parameters:
        c - - the Color to check
        Returns:
        true if c in COLOR, false otherwise.

      • getColor

        public static java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String s)
        Return the color represented by s (its toString format), that color's toString() output. (null if no such color exits, or if the color isn't in COLOR).

      • cost

        public static int cost(int s)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the cost of traveling one frame at rate of speed s. The most efficient speed is in middle. See Truck.MIN_SPEED, Truck.MAX_SPEED for boundary values, Truck.EFFICIENT_SPEED for most cost-effective speed to travel.

        Cost =
        if (s < Efficient_Speed) -> s + 1
        else if (s > Efficient_Speed) -> s + fib(s - Efficient_Speed)
        else -> s
        1 : 2
        2 : 3
        3 : 4
        4 : 4
        5 : 6
        6 : 8
        7 : 10
        8 : 13
        9 : 17
        10 : 22
        Returns:
        -Cost, calculated using the above equation. Sample values are in table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s is out of the range min..max.
